item.title: Numerous potholes in pavement and crumbling tarmac, 18th April
item.description:
Kensington Avenue is situated right next to a Cheltenham Train Station. It is a very busy cul de sac and as a result a large volume of cars, taxis, vans and lorries turn at the end of the road. The road is narrow and as such they mount the pavement and turn on it. The pavement at the end of the road is therefore badly damaged. It is very unsafe and my elderly grandparents who regularly visit are at risk and have almost tripped and fallen on several occasions . The pavement that needs a full resurface is the corner which runs along the frontage of 17 Kensington Avenue and 18 Kensington Avenue Thanks very much for your help

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Kensington Avenue, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fridge fly tipped by Berkeley Court, 18th April
item.description:
A fridge has been dumped by Berkeley Court - next to the entrances of 41-48

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Berkeley Place, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sustained damage problem, 18th April
item.description:
12/04/24 email rcvd - Dear TBC Hope all is well. Wonder if you can help us, we had a bollard outside the nursery to prevent cars mounting the pavement outside the nursery. Unfortunately, it has been knocked down a few times. One of the local residents telephoned this morning to express his concerns at a potential incident on Monday with a speeding car when little children were around. Are you able to reinstate the bollard please to prevent cars mounting the pavement when children are outside the building. I look forward to hearing from you.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 18th April
item.description:
Customer reports a large pothole in the carriageway.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The surface water from the fields runs across the road outside our house but because the drains are blocked the water is building up and not draining away. Passing traffic are hitting the rocks along the side of the road as they cannot see them under the water. We and our neighbours have tried to clear the blockage but have not been able to and we are all worried that it may cause flooding and traffic accidents if it is not repaired if left unrepaires, 18th April
item.description:
Outside properties Hyak and Whitton Dean on Brockhampton Lane GL54 5TH
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Charlton Abbots Road, Sevenhampton, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Incorrect road markings, 18th April
item.description:
8 Brandon place, Cheltenham, GL50 2HE. The road markings are incorrect. No one is disabled. The lady who used to live here was, she passed away and we own the house now. We would like the markings disabled markings and bay removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brandon Place, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
